_note: This is SOURCE DATA for import, not a direct database dump. IANTD (International Association of Nitrox and Technical Divers) was founded in 1985 as the first agency to introduce enriched air nitrox to recreational diving. Known for pioneering technical diving, trimix, and rebreather training.
agencyName: International Association of Nitrox and Technical Divers

courses.name: Supervised Diver
courses.description: Entry-level program providing basic training for those who wish to enter SCUBA diving adventures within limited time. Qualifies a diver to dive to a maximum depth of 40 fsw (12 msw) under direct supervision.

courses.name: Open Water Diver
courses.description: Comprehensive entry-level certification based on IANTD's training philosophy of repetition. A relaxed, confident diver is a safe diver who will enjoy exploring inner-space and pursue diving adventures for a lifetime.

courses.name: Advanced Open Water Diver
courses.description: Mid-level Continuing Education Program designed to enable IANTD Open Water Divers to extend their proficiency in the water and gain more supervised practical experience. Qualifies diver to dive to a maximum depth of 100 fsw (30 msw).
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Diver or equivalent
requiredItems: IANTD Advanced Open Water Student Kit

courses.name: Rescue Diver
courses.description: Comprehensive training in self-rescue and buddy rescue techniques. The Diving First Aid, CPR and Oxygen Administrator Programs may be taken concurrently.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced Open Water Diver or equivalent, proof of minimum 10 logged dives

courses.name: Enriched Air Nitrox Diver (EANx)
courses.description: IANTD pioneered nitrox training for recreational divers. This program covers the use of EANx mixes in the range of 21% to a maximum of 40% oxygen. No dives may be conducted to depths greater than the student's previous qualification, or maximum 132 fsw (40 msw).
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Deep Diver
courses.description: Designed to provide responsible training to divers who plan to dive to a maximum of 130 fsw (39 msw) on air. Training covers skills, performance, theory and planning of deep dives. No dives having mandatory decompression exceeding 3 minutes may be made.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced Open Water Diver or equivalent, minimum 30 logged dives

courses.name: Advanced EANx Diver
courses.description: The first and most complete programme of its kind, designed for dives using two Nitrox mixes - one for bottom and one for decompression - to maximum depth of 42 msw (140 fsw) with decompression stops up to 15 minutes. Uses EANx mixtures up to 1.5 PO2 for decompression.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD EANx Diver and IANTD Deep Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Technical Diver
courses.description: Designed to train divers to conduct dives to depths between 100 fsw (30 msw) and up to 170 fsw (51 msw). Allows dives to maximum depth of 48 metres using air, and up to 51 metres using optimal Nitrox mixes.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced EANx Diver or equivalent, IANTD Rescue Diver and Oxygen Provider certifications, minimum 100 logged dives with 30 deeper than 30m

courses.name: Advanced Recreational Trimix Diver
courses.description: Qualifies divers to dive up to 150 fsw (45 msw) and perform decompression stops required dives using trimix to reduce narcosis. Equivalent Narcotic Depth (END) managed to maximum 36 msw (120 fsw).
courses.prerequisites: IANTD EANx Diver or equivalent, minimum 30 logged dives
requiredItems: IANTD Advanced Recreational Trimix Student Kit

courses.name: Advanced Recreational Trimix Plus Diver
courses.description: Qualifies divers to dive up to 170 fsw (51 msw) and perform decompression stops required dives. Extended depth capability using trimix for narcosis management.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced Recreational Trimix Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Normoxic Trimix Diver
courses.description: Designed to train divers who wish to dive to depths between 39 and 60 msw (130 and 200 fsw), using normoxic trimix to avoid breathing air below 39 msw. Trimix affords managing nitrogen narcosis by reducing END to maximum 36 msw (120 fsw).
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced EANx Diver or higher, minimum 100 logged dives with 30 deeper than 90 fsw (27 msw)

courses.name: Normoxic Trimix Plus Diver
courses.description: Extended normoxic trimix training for deeper operations. Builds on Normoxic Trimix certification with additional depth capability and gas management skills.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Normoxic Trimix Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Trimix Diver
courses.description: Full trimix certification qualifying divers to perform trimix dives outside of training up to 333 fsw (100 msw). Comprehensive training in hypoxic trimix operations and advanced decompression procedures.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Normoxic Trimix Diver or equivalent, minimum 200 logged dives with 25 between 140-200 fsw (42-60 msw)

courses.name: Expedition Trimix Diver
courses.description: The pinnacle of open circuit technical diving. Qualifies divers to perform trimix dives to maximum depth of 120 msw (400 fsw) with multiple stages and use of surface and in-water support team.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Trimix Diver or equivalent, minimum 300 logged dives with 100 trimix dives

courses.name: Elite Technical Diver
courses.description: Recognition of the highest achievement in technical diving before entering the professional diving circle. Comprehensive skills in all aspects of technical diving operations.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Trimix Diver or equivalent with extensive technical diving experience

courses.name: Cavern Diver
courses.description: First step between recreational and technical diving for overhead environments. Develops awareness, personal responsibility, and risk management within the limits of light zones. Always maintains visible exit.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced Open Water Diver or equivalent, minimum 50 dives including 10 night dives

courses.name: Introductory Cave Diver
courses.description: Introduction to the cave diving environment for Sport Divers. Trains navigation using primary guidelines with basic jump and gap procedures. No dives to depths greater than 132 fsw (40 msw).
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Cavern Diver, Wreck Diver, or Limited Mine Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Cave Diver
courses.description: Full cave certification training divers in safe cave diving. Master navigation through complex cave systems, manage gas reserves, and handle unique challenges of overhead environments. No dives to depths greater than 132 fsw (40 msw).
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Introductory Cave Diver or equivalent, minimum 18 years old

courses.name: Technical Cave Diver
courses.description: Advanced cave diving using mixed gas for exploration, including EANx and oxygen for decompression. Exposure to wide variety of conditions: silt, halocline, circuits, traverses, gaps, jumps, T's, siphons, and restrictions.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Cave Diver and IANTD Advanced EANx Diver or equivalent, minimum 50 logged dives

courses.name: Advanced Cave Diver - Stage/Multi-Stage
courses.description: Advanced training for extended penetration using staging and multiple staging techniques. Learn complex dive planning, multiple gas management methods, and extended bottom times.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Technical Cave Diver or equivalent, minimum 25 logged cave dives, 10 dives with stage cylinders

courses.name: Advanced Cave Diver - DPV
courses.description: Specialized advanced course for highly experienced cave divers. Learn DPV mechanics, turn pressure calculations with DPV, navigation at higher speeds, and emergency procedures including towing.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Technical Cave Diver and/or Stage Cave Diver, minimum 50 cave dives, 25 dives with DPV

courses.name: Advanced Cave Diver - Sidemount/No Mount
courses.description: Familiarizes experienced technical cave divers with techniques, equipment and mindset for sidemount and no-mount diving in overhead environments. Addresses conservation concerns and ethical responsibilities.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Technical Cave Diver or equivalent, minimum 50 logged cave dives

courses.name: Advanced Cave Diver - Survey
courses.description: Training in cave surveying techniques, exploration methodology, data collection, and documentation procedures. Covers proper survey protocols and conservation considerations.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Technical Cave Diver or equivalent, minimum 50 logged cave dives

courses.name: Elite Technical Cave Diver
courses.description: Highest recognition at cave level before entering the professional diving circle. Comprehensive mastery of all cave diving techniques and environments.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Technical Cave Diver with all advanced specialties, extensive cave diving experience

courses.name: Limited Mine Diver
courses.description: Entry-level overhead environment training for mine diving within the limits of light penetration. Develops awareness, self-responsibility and risk management skills.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Introductory Mine Diver
courses.description: Introduction to mine diving beyond cavern zone. Develops navigation skills and emergency procedures specific to mine environments.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Cavern Diver, Limited Mine Diver, or Wreck Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Mine Diver
courses.description: Full mine diver certification training divers in safe mine diving techniques, navigation, and emergency procedures specific to flooded mine environments.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Introductory Mine Diver and IANTD Advanced EANx Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Technical Mine Diver
courses.description: Technical mine diving using mixed gas for extended penetration and decompression operations in flooded mine environments.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Mine Diver or equivalent, minimum 50 logged mine dives

courses.name: Advanced Mine Diver - Sidemount
courses.description: Advanced sidemount techniques for mine diving environments. Enables technical mine divers to proficiently assemble and use sidemount diving equipment in mine conditions.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Technical Mine Diver or higher, minimum 50 logged mine dives

courses.name: Advanced Mine Diver - DPV
courses.description: Advanced training in mine diving skills for dives warranting Diver Propulsion Vehicle use and techniques in mine environments.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Technical Mine Diver or equivalent, minimum 50 logged mine dives

courses.name: Wreck Diver
courses.description: Develops wreck diving skills within limits of light penetration. Ensures divers are aware of self-responsibility and capable of risk management in overhead wreck environments.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Tek Lite Wreck Diver
courses.description: Training in wreck penetration diving and utilization of EANx for wreck exploration with EANx and oxygen for decompression. Bridge between sport and technical wreck diving.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Wreck Diver or Cavern Diver, IANTD Deep Diver, minimum 40 logged dives; or IANTD Advanced EANx Diver with 70 logged dives

courses.name: Technical Wreck Diver
courses.description: Extended wreck penetration diving using EANx for exploration and decompression. Minimum 240 minutes bottom time in 6 wreck penetration dives. No dives deeper than 170 fsw (51 msw).
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Tek Lite Wreck Diver or equivalent, minimum 100 logged dives

courses.name: Advanced Wreck Diver
courses.description: Advanced skills and knowledge for safe wreck exploration and penetration with strong sense of personal responsibility and risk management. Conducted using Nitrox or Trimix based on diver certification.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Technical Wreck Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Recreational Oxygen CCR Diver
courses.description: Basic oxygen-only rebreather training. Qualifies diver to dive to maximum depth of 20 fsw (6 msw) using oxygen CCR. Introduction to rebreather technology.
courses.prerequisites: Proof of 20 open-water dives with at least 15 hours underwater time

courses.name: Recreational CCR Diver
courses.description: Entry-level CCR certification. Train in safer use and technology of basic CCR diving with no decompression, up to 1.2 PO2 to depths up to 70 fsw (21 msw). Can be entry-level to SCUBA if combined with Open Water.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD EANx Diver or equivalent, or may be taken with EANx class

courses.name: Recreational Deep CCR Diver
courses.description: Extends recreational CCR limits to 40m. Training in deeper CCR operations within recreational no-decompression limits.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Recreational CCR Diver, IANTD Deep Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Recreational Trimix CCR Diver
courses.description: Provides RCCR divers with trimix breathing medium for extending diving capabilities while managing narcosis at recreational depths.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Recreational CCR Diver or Recreational SCR Diver

courses.name: CCR Advanced EANx Diver
courses.description: Train recreational divers in safer use and technology of CCR diving for dives requiring up to 15 minutes decompression to depths up to 132 fsw (40 msw). MOD1 certification level.
courses.prerequisites: 20 CCR dives with 20 hours underwater, IANTD EANx Diver and Deep Diver or RCCR Deep Diver or equivalent

courses.name: CCR Advanced Recreational Trimix Diver
courses.description: CCR training using trimix diluent for dives to 150 fsw (45 msw) with decompression. Manages narcosis through helium addition to diluent.
courses.prerequisites: 20 CCR dives with 20 hours underwater, IANTD EANx Diver and Deep Diver or equivalent

courses.name: CCR Advanced Recreational Trimix Plus Diver
courses.description: Train recreational divers in safer use of trimix and CCR technology for dives with mandatory decompression using up to 1.3 PO2 to depths up to 170 fsw (51 msw).
courses.prerequisites: IANTD CCR Advanced Recreational Trimix Diver or equivalent

courses.name: CCR Normoxic Trimix Diver
courses.description: Train divers in safe use of CCR for dives using normoxic helium-based gas mixtures for diluent and stages. Requires 50 logged CCR dives with 50 hours, 25 on specific unit.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD CCR Advanced EANx Diver or equivalent, 50 logged CCR dives with 50 hours

courses.name: CCR Trimix Diver
courses.description: Full CCR trimix certification for dives up to 100m using trimix diluent. MOD3 level training for deep CCR diving. Requires 100 logged CCR dives with 100 hours.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD CCR Normoxic Trimix Diver, minimum 100 logged CCR dives with 100 hours

courses.name: CCR Expedition Trimix Diver
courses.description: Pinnacle of CCR diving. Certifies to 120 msw (400 fsw) for expedition-level dives. Covers skills necessary for deep expedition operations. Requires 200 CCR dives and 300 hours.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD CCR Trimix Diver, minimum 200 CCR dives of 300 total dives, 300 hours on CCR unit to be used

courses.name: RCCR Cavern and Limited Mine Diver
courses.description: Develop cavern diving skills within light penetration limits using recreational CCR. Focus on self-responsibility and risk management in overhead environments.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Recreational Rebreather Advanced Open Water Diver, minimum 20 CCR dives and 25 hours

courses.name: RCCR Introductory Cave Diver
courses.description: Introduction to cave diving using recreational CCR. Navigation using primary guidelines with basic jump and gap procedures.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD RCCR Cavern Diver or equivalent

courses.name: CCR Cave Diver
courses.description: Full CCR cave diving certification. Training in safe CCR cave diving techniques, navigation, and emergency procedures.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD CCR Introductory Cave Diver and IANTD CCR Advanced EANx Diver or equivalent

courses.name: CCR Technical Wreck Diver
courses.description: Extended wreck penetration using CCR with EANx for exploration and decompression. No dives deeper than 150 fsw (45 msw). Requires 100 CCR dives.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD CCR Advanced EANx Diver or equivalent with 100 CCR dives; or OC Technical Wreck Diver to CCR crossover with 25 CCR dives and 50 hours

courses.name: Advanced Cave DPV Rebreather Diver
courses.description: Advanced training in cave diving with DPV use on rebreathers. For experienced certified cave divers conducting extended penetration dives.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD CCR Cave Diver or equivalent, minimum 50 cave dives and 50 hours on CCR

courses.name: Recreational SCR Diver
courses.description: Train competent divers in safer use and technology of basic SCR diving with no decompression, using mixtures EAN 40 and higher to depths up to 70 fsw (21 msw). Can be combined with Open Water for entry-level.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD EANx Diver or equivalent, or may be taken with EANx class

courses.name: Open Water Sidemount Diver
courses.description: Familiarize divers with techniques, equipment, and mindset for sidemount diving. Enables proficient assembly and use of sidemount equipment in open water.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Diver or equivalent. May be combined with Open Water course.

courses.name: Tek Open Water Sidemount Diver
courses.description: Advanced sidemount techniques for technical diving. Covers dives up to 42 meters (140 feet) with decompression procedures. Prepares for cave or trimix training.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced EANx Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Open Water DPV Diver
courses.description: Provides overall awareness of DPV diving and ability to perform DPV dives in open water. No dives deeper than previous certification level.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Technical DPV Diver
courses.description: Skills and knowledge for safe use of Underwater Propulsion Vehicles (DPV) in open water with technical diving equipment and procedures. Minimum 5 dives over 3 days.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced EANx Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Ice Diver
courses.description: Training in safe ice diving techniques, preparation, and overall awareness of ice environment. Covers ice evaluation, hole cutting, diver deployment, communications, safety procedures, and emergency protocols.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Dry Suit Diver
courses.description: Training on how to use, care for, and handle specific emergencies related to dry suit diving. No dives deeper than previous certification level.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Night Diver
courses.description: Training in night diving techniques including proper use of lights, communication, navigation, and emergency procedures in limited visibility conditions.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Navigation Diver
courses.description: Compass use, kick cycles, visual landmarks, and time-based navigation techniques. Improves underwater navigation skills for all diving environments.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Search and Recovery Diver
courses.description: Training in search patterns, recovery techniques, and proper use of lift bags. Develops skills for locating and recovering objects underwater.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Public Safety Diver
courses.description: OSHA approved and NFPA compliant program for Search and Recovery Dive Teams. Covers team composition, liability, safety procedures, site evaluation, search operations, underwater investigation and recovery.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced Open Water Diver or equivalent, active public safety team member or volunteer

courses.name: Nitrox (EANx) Gas Blender
courses.description: Training in safe handling of oxygen and preparation of Nitrox breathing gases. Covers blending methods, quality control, and safety protocols. Any person can take this class - does not need to be a diver.
courses.prerequisites: Need to become a blender (work for EANx facility) or IANTD EANx Diver in remote area. Must be recommended by IANTD Instructor or Facility.
requiredItems: Access to blending equipment for practical training

courses.name: Trimix Gas Blender
courses.description: Training in safe handling of oxygen and preparation of Trimix and Heliox breathing gases. Comprehensive training in blending techniques and safety procedures.
courses.prerequisites: Need to become a blender (work for facility) or IANTD Trimix Diver in remote area. Must be recommended by IANTD Instructor or Facility.
requiredItems: Access to trimix blending equipment for practical training

courses.name: Oxygen Provider
courses.description: Training in emergency oxygen administration for diving accidents. Essential prerequisite for many advanced and professional courses.

courses.name: Diving First Aid
courses.description: Comprehensive first aid training specifically designed for dive-related injuries and emergencies. Covers assessment, treatment, and management of diving accidents.

courses.name: Divemaster
courses.description: First professional level designed to provide responsible training for those wishing to supervise IANTD divers including Open Water, Advanced Open Water, EANx, and Rescue Divers. 40 total training hours minimum.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Rescue Diver or equivalent, Oxygen Provider and Diving First Aid certifications

courses.name: Assistant Instructor
courses.description: Leadership training for those preparing to become full instructors. Assists qualified instructors with student training and gains teaching experience.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Divemaster or equivalent

courses.name: Open Water Instructor
courses.description: Train qualified IANTD Divemasters or Assistant Instructors as IANTD Open Water Instructors. Upon completion, may teach and evaluate IANTD courses and conduct Crossover Programs.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Divemaster or Assistant Instructor or equivalent, minimum 100 logged dives with 15 to appropriate depths

courses.name: EANx Instructor
courses.description: Training to teach IANTD EANx Diver courses. Covers curriculum, teaching methods, and evaluation procedures specific to nitrox training.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Instructor and IANTD EANx Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Advanced EANx Instructor
courses.description: Training to teach IANTD Advanced EANx Diver courses. Covers technical diving instruction, curriculum delivery, and student evaluation.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD EANx Instructor and IANTD Advanced EANx Diver or equivalent, minimum 150 logged dives

courses.name: Technical Diver Instructor
courses.description: Training to teach IANTD Technical Diver courses. Comprehensive instructor preparation for technical diving education.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Advanced EANx Instructor and IANTD Technical Diver or equivalent, minimum 200 logged dives

courses.name: Trimix Instructor
courses.description: Training to teach IANTD Trimix Diver courses at all levels. Comprehensive instruction in teaching hypoxic and normoxic trimix diving.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Technical Diver Instructor and IANTD Trimix Diver or equivalent, minimum 300 logged dives with 50 trimix dives

courses.name: Cave Instructor
courses.description: Training to teach IANTD Cave Diver courses through full cave level. Comprehensive instructor preparation for cave diving education.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Instructor and IANTD Cave Diver or equivalent, minimum 100 logged cave dives

courses.name: Technical Cave Instructor
courses.description: Training to teach IANTD Technical Cave Diver and advanced cave courses. Highest cave instructor certification before Course Director level.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Cave Instructor and IANTD Technical Cave Diver or equivalent, minimum 200 logged cave dives

courses.name: Rebreather Instructor
courses.description: Training to teach IANTD Rebreather Diver courses on specific units. Must be qualified instructor on the specific rebreather being taught.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water Instructor and CCR Diver on specific unit, minimum 100 hours on unit

courses.name: Open Water Instructor Crossover
courses.description: Crossover program for instructors from other agencies to become IANTD Open Water Instructors. Must be active teaching status with internationally accredited association.
courses.prerequisites: Sport Diving Instructor in active teaching status with internationally accredited association, Oxygen Provider and Diving First Aid certifications, minimum 110 logged dives

courses.name: Instructor Trainer
courses.description: Open Water EANx Instructor Trainer program to provide training for IANTD Instructor Trainers. May conduct instructor level training and evaluation.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Open Water and EANx Instructor, minimum 2 years teaching experience, 100+ certifications issued

courses.name: Assistant Course Director
courses.description: Preparation for Course Director level. Assists Course Directors with instructor development programs and gains experience in instructor training.
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Instructor Trainer, minimum 2 years as IT without Quality Assurance complaints

courses.name: Course Director
courses.description: Elite group of professionals who provide training to next generation of IANTD Instructors. Teach Assistant Course Director Programs and Instructor Development Programs (IDP).
courses.prerequisites: IANTD Assistant Course Director, minimum 2 years teaching without Quality Assurance complaints, 100+ certifications in combination of OW, AOW, EANx, Deep, Rescue, and Divemaster programs
